Models¶

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.BodyPart(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The BodyPart model is used by the Item model. An item will have a BodyPart that it can be placed on. This model is used in the case that only one item can be equipped per body part.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.CollectedItem(id, item, inventory, equipped)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.CollectedPet(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Whenever a user purchases a pet, an instance of the CollectedPet is created. It is used to provide a many-to-many link between pets and users.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.CollectedScenery(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Whenever a user purchases a scenery, an instance of the CollectedScenery model is created. This is used to create a many-to-many relationship between a user and a scenery item

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Experience(id, pet, amount, date)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Happiness(id, pet, amount, date)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Inventory(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The Inventory model is used for keeping track of all a users pets, items, etc.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Item(id, experience_to_unlock, image_location, description, name, cost, belongs_to, body_part)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Level(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Each user pet has an instance of the Level model, this is to determine its current level and the amount of exerience required to progress to the next one.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallenge(id, name, overview, challenge_type, duration_mins)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallengeGoal(id, micro_challenge, medal, description, pet_pennies_reward, goal_state)[source]¶

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallengeState(id, steps)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Mood(id, pet, level, happiness_needed, image_location, description)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Pet(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.PetSwap(id, from_pet, to_pet, time_swapped)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Phrase(id, mood, text)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Profile(id, user, inventory, current_pet, total_pet_pennies, last_fitbit_sync)[source]¶
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Scenery(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Every possible scenery item available for a user to purchase will need an instance of the Scenery model. It provides information such as the experience to unlock, the location path to the image, a short description of the image, the name of the scene, and also the cost to purchase this scenery item.
